Key Match Events: Altuve had three hits and scored three times.
Peña’s 15th homer was a three-run shot, capping a five-run sixth inning that started with the Astros clinging to a one-run lead.
Chas McCormick tied the game with a two-run single.
Yordan Alvarez’s two-out RBI single put the Astros on top.
Alex Bregman capped the flurry with a bases-loaded walk.
Peña’s three-run drive into the Houston bullpen in right-center field.
Post-Match Reflections: Altuve expressed satisfaction with putting runs on the board.
Peña highlighted the importance of getting runs early and letting the pitching staff take over.
Manager Joe Espada praised the team's offensive approach.
Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo acknowledged mistakes in execution and defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kikuchi (8-9) allowed four runs and seven hits over six innings.
Rodriguez (2-2) faced 10 batters and needed 47 pitches to get through the inning.
Alvarez finished with three hits and is batting.410 with 13 RBIs over his last 10 games.
Others: The Astros improved to 7-0 in games started by Yusei Kikuchi.
Houston increased its lead in the AL West to 5 1/2 games over Seattle.
Arizona, which has dropped three straight and seven of 10, holds a half-game edge over the New York Mets for the second National League wild card.
